alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 9:01PM CDT until July 05 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: .Repeated storms have lead to some local, brief flooding in the Milwaukee metro area. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Milwaukee and Waukesha. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milwaukee, Waukesha, West Allis, Wauwatosa, New Berlin, Brookfield, Greenfield, Menomonee Falls, Oak Creek, South Milwaukee, Cudahy, Whitefish Bay, Greendale, Pewaukee, Sussex, St. Francis, Hartland, Hales Corners, Delafield and Elm Grove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
